country.name: Pitcairn Islands
country.overview: The Pitcairn Islands, officially Pitcairn, Henderson, Ducie and Oeno Islands, are a group of four volcanic islands in the southern Pacific Ocean that form the last British Overseas Territory in the South Pacific.

geography.location_description: Oceania, islands in the South Pacific Ocean, about midway between Peru and New Zealand
geography.area_note: about three-tenths the size of Washington, DC
geography.climate: tropical; hot and humid; modified by southeast trade winds; rainy season (November to March)
geography.terrain: rugged volcanic formation; rocky coastline with cliffs
geography.notes: Britain's most isolated dependency; only the larger island of Pitcairn is inhabited but it has no port or natural harbor; supplies must be transported by rowed longboat from larger ships stationed offshore
